intro: Psychotria stevensiana, commonly known as the "Stevens's Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other plants with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded forest environments. Psychotria stevensiana is also notable for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though research on its properties remains limited.
